name: treatment of used vegetable cooking oil, purification | used vegetable cooking oil, purified | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10603/documentation

This dataset represents the purification of waste vegetable cooking oil before its esterification. ;This dataset could be too used for the treatment of waste animal fat. The studied plant treats both types of waste. ;;Data have been collected for the annual production of the esterification plant and adapted to production of one liter of vegetable oil methyl esther. To fit with the current ecoinvent datasets, collected data have been divided between a purification step and an esterification step. This dataset considers only the purification step. 

From reception of waste cooking oil at factory gate. 

This activity ends at esterification plant with the purified used vegetable cooking oil. 
The dataset includes the treatment of impurities and water removal from the used vegetable cooking oil, the intermediate storage of the oil and treatment of specific wastewater effluents.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data from 2012, current technology in Quebec.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from one biodiesel producer in the Quebec region.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical waste oil esterification plant designed for methyl ester production (for the vehicle fuels market), Quebec context. Based on industrial data from one biodiesel producer in the Quebec region with a low production volume (2 000 000 litres of biodiesel per year).  The transesterification is base-catalysed with sodium methoxide and sodium hydroxide.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Data from one biodiesel producer used to represent the total Québec region production.
Energy consumption of the plant has been divided between purification and esterification seps based on industrial expertise.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Industrial data from one biodiesel producer in the Quebec region.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. All the water in the used cooking oil input is supposed to be extracte durng purification. 
Mass of purified used cooking oil produced = (mass of used cooking oil input without water) - used oil loss

defaultProvider.name: market for used vegetable cooking oil | used vegetable cooking oil | Cutoff, U

exchanges.description: Calculated value. According to emissions of used oil to soil.
Calculated value. According to emissions of used oil to soil.

Calculated based on reported fuel input (measured value), the Net Heating Value of the fuel and efficiency (1/fuel_use). 60% of energy consumption on site is associated to the purification step (estimation from industrial).
